The study cited by the claim was conduct: S. Air Force personnel who underwent gender-affirming hormone therapy in their mid-20s.
The study compared the pre: and post-hormone performance of transgender men and women on speed and upper-body strength tests.
The study found that after two years of: transgender women maintained a 12% faster speed on a 1.5-mile run compared to cisgender women.
However: the study also found that the strength advantage of transgender women disappeared over the same interval, indicating a diminishing advantage over time.
